backend/main.mo: Minimal Motoko backend actor with no methods or state defined.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report specifying that HeroSection.tsx should replace its profile image src with a LinkedIn CDN URL while retaining existing alt text, className, and error handling.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON document summarizing each frontend source file's purpose and notable recent changes for the Vibhanshu Meshram CV project.
frontend/index.css: Global Tailwind CSS entry point defining OKLCH-based CSS custom properties for light and dark color themes including background, foreground, primary, and sidebar tokens.
frontend/index.html: HTML shell that mounts the React app at #root and preloads Inter and Merriweather fonts from Google Fonts.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component that assembles all CV sections (Hero, Experience, Education, Skills, Projects, Contact) with TopNav and a personalized footer for Vibhanshu Meshram.
frontend/src/components/cv/ContactSectio: Renders a grid of clickable contact cards (email, phone, LinkedIn, Google Drive, website, Twitter) filtered to only show items with valid hrefs.
frontend/src/components/cv/EducationSect: Displays a list of education entries as cards showing degree, institution, date range, optional location, and bullet-point details.
frontend/src/components/cv/ExperienceSec: Renders a vertical timeline of work experience entries with role, company, optional location, and bullet-point descriptions.
frontend/src/components/cv/HeroSection.t: Hero section displaying a profile photo sourced from data.profilePhoto with a local asset fallback on error, plus name, title, location, summary, and scroll-to-section buttons.
frontend/src/components/cv/ProjectsSecti: Renders a responsive grid of project cards each showing title, description, technology badges, and optional live demo and GitHub links.
frontend/src/components/cv/Section.tsx: Generic section wrapper that applies consistent padding, max-width, and a styled h2 heading to any CV section.
frontend/src/components/cv/SkillsSection: Displays skill categories in a two-column card grid with badge-style skill tags styled using the primary color.
frontend/src/components/cv/TopNav.tsx: A fixed top navigation bar component with smooth-scroll links to CV sections, active section highlighting based on scroll position, and a responsive mobile hamburger menu.
frontend/src/data/cv.ts: Defines TypeScript interfaces for all CV data structures and exports a static `cvData` object containing Vibhanshu Meshram's hero, experience, education, skills, projects, and contact information.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: A React Query hook that creates and caches an ICP backend actor, using an anonymous actor when unauthenticated or an identity-bound actor when logged in, and invalidates dependent queries when the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an `InternetIdentityProvider` context and `useInternetIdentity` hook for managing DFINITY Internet Identity authentication, including login, logout, and identity persistence via AuthClient.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: An intentionally empty placeholder file noting that no backend queries are needed since all CV data is sourced statically.
frontend/src/hooks/useSeoFromCvData.ts: A hook that dynamically sets the document title and injects/updates meta tags (description, Open Graph, Twitter Card) based on the provided CV hero data.
frontend/src/index.css: Global Tailwind CSS entry point defining a warm earthy OKLCH-based design token palette for both light and dark modes, plus base body and HTML styles.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that mounts the React app wrapped with `QueryClientProvider` and `InternetIdentityProvider` into the DOM root.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration extending the theme with custom OKLCH color tokens, font families, border radii, box shadows, accordion animations, and enabling typography, container-queries, and animate plugins.
project_state.json: Project state metadata file tracking version, existing features, and a completed feature request to replace the Hero section profile photo src with an external LinkedIn image URL.
